features.notes: Numbers are represented as double and used pervasively across arithmetic, comparison, and control-flow tests.
Backed by .NET System.String; values are boxed/unboxed where needed in member calls and concatenation.
Emits proper IL for true/false and boxes when needed in arrays/log calls. See generator snapshot: Js2IL.Tests/Literals/GeneratorTests.BooleanLiteral.verified.txt.
Concatenates quasis and expressions via runtime Operators.Add with JS string/number coercion. Tagged templates are not yet supported.
null emission validated in literals and variable tests; see execution snapshot Js2IL.Tests/Literals/ExecutionTests.Literals_NullAndUndefined.verified.txt.
Handled as the ECMAScript undefined value and participates in JS truthiness; see execution snapshot Js2IL.Tests/Literals/ExecutionTests.Literals_NullAndUndefined.verified.txt.
Emitted as static methods with delegate creation and closure binding as needed; supports immediate invocation patterns (IIFE).

features.feature: Named function expressions (internal self-binding for recursion)
features.notes: On first entry, the internal name is eagerly bound to a self-delegate via JavaScriptRuntime.Closure.CreateSelfDelegate(MethodBase, int), enabling recursion from within the function body.

Block scoping, shadowing chain, nested function capture, and simple const initialization implemented. Temporal dead zone access error (Variable_TemporalDeadZoneAccess.js) and reads before initialization are still pending.
Assignment to a const Identifier and ++/-- on const emit a runtime TypeError; error is catchable via try/catch.

features.feature: Destructuring in variable declarations (object/array patterns, defaults, rest, nested)
features.notes: Supports object and array binding patterns in variable declarators (const/let/var), including nested patterns, default values, and rest elements/properties. The initializer is evaluated once, then bindings are populated via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.GetItem (string keys for objects, numeric indices for arrays). Object rest ({ a, ...rest }) uses JavaScriptRuntime.Object.Rest to create a new object excluding the bound keys; array rest ([a, ...rest]) builds a new JavaScriptRuntime.Array from the remaining indices. Handles both uncaptured variables (stored in IL locals) and captured variables (stored in scope fields), including cases where destructured bindings are captured by nested functions. Limitations: computed keys in patterns are not yet supported.

features.feature: Object destructuring in function/arrow parameters — basic
features.notes: Supports object binding patterns in formal parameters for function declarations and arrow functions, including shorthand (e.g., {a,b}), aliasing (e.g., { a: x }), and default values (e.g., {host="localhost", port=8080}). Default values use conditional IL generation with brfalse branching: property is retrieved, if null the default expression is evaluated, otherwise the retrieved value is used. Limitations: no nested patterns, no rest properties, and no array patterns in parameters. Properties are retrieved via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.GetProperty and bound into the function scope before body execution.

features.feature: Object destructuring in class constructor/method parameters
features.notes: Class constructors and instance methods support object destructuring parameters with full default value support (e.g., constructor({host="localhost", port=8080})). Uses the same conditional IL generation as functions/arrows. Shared implementation in MethodBuilder.EmitObjectPatternParameterDestructuring handles all function types uniformly. Supports shorthand, aliasing, and default values. Limitations: no nested patterns, no rest properties, no array patterns.
Hoisted and initialized before top-level statement evaluation so functions can call each other by name prior to IIFE invocation.

Covers expression- and block-bodied arrows, multiple parameters, nested functions, closure capture across scopes (including returning functions that capture globals/locals), and default parameter values. Not yet supported: rest parameters, lexical this/arguments semantics, and spread at call sites.

Default parameter values are supported for function declarations, function expressions, and arrow functions. Supports literal defaults (numbers, strings, booleans) and expression defaults that reference previous parameters (e.g., function f(a, b = a * 2)). Implemented using starg IL pattern when arguments are null. Call sites validate argument count ranges and pad missing optional parameters with ldnull.
Covers creation, element access, and length property. See also verified output in Literals/GeneratorTests.ArrayLiteral.verified.txt.
Spread elements in array literals are emitted via JavaScriptRuntime.Array.PushRange; supports copying from another array.
Covers creation and property access. See also verified output in Literals/GeneratorTests.ObjectLiteral.verified.txt.

Supported in the new IR pipeline for global (non-shadowed) built-in Error identifiers with 0 or 1 argument. When provided, the message is coerced to string. User-defined constructors / classes and member-expression callees (e.g., new obj.Ctor()) are not yet supported in the IR pipeline.

features.feature: NewExpression for built-in Array constructor (new Array()/new Array(n)/new Array(a,b,...))
features.notes: Supported in the new IR pipeline for global (non-shadowed) Array. Lowered via JavaScriptRuntime.Array::Construct(object[] args) to preserve JS Array constructor semantics.

features.feature: NewExpression for built-in String constructor as primitive sugar (new String()/new String(x))
features.notes: Supported in the new IR pipeline for global (non-shadowed) String. Lowered to primitive string conversion (DotNet2JSConversions.ToString).

features.feature: NewExpression for built-in Boolean/Number constructors as primitive sugar (new Boolean(x), new Number(x))
features.notes: Supported in the new IR pipeline for global (non-shadowed) Boolean/Number. Lowered to primitive coercions (TypeUtilities.ToBoolean/ToNumber).

features.feature: NewExpression for constructible runtime intrinsics (e.g., Date, Int32Array)
features.notes: Supported in the new IR pipeline for global (non-shadowed) intrinsic identifiers registered in JavaScriptRuntime.IntrinsicObjectRegistry that are constructible classes. Currently limited to 0–2 constructor arguments.

features.feature: Primitive conversion callables: String(x), Number(x), Boolean(x)
features.notes: Supports the callable form (no new) for global (non-shadowed) String/Number/Boolean. Semantics match JS: no-arg returns default ("" / +0 / false); extra arguments are evaluated for side effects but ignored. Conversions are implemented via JavaScriptRuntime.TypeUtilities (ToString/ToNumber/ToBoolean); Number(undefined) yields NaN (undefined represented as CLR null).
Implemented via JavaScriptRuntime.TypeUtilities::Typeof and IL emission for UnaryExpression(typeof). typeof null returns 'object'; functions report 'function'; objects report 'object'.
Increments the value first, then returns the new value.
Decrements the value first, then returns the new value.
Converts operand to int32, applies bitwise NOT, converts back to double. Used in bit manipulation patterns.

Supported end-to-end in IR pipeline (HIR unary + LIRLogicalNot) using JavaScriptRuntime.TypeUtilities.ToBoolean for JS truthiness, then invert. Covered both in a dedicated unary-operator fixture and in control-flow conditionals (if (!x) ...).
Fast-path string concat; general '+' follows JS coercion via runtime helper.
Numeric subtraction; matches JS semantics for non-numeric via coercion helpers where applicable.

Covers numeric and boolean equality, including comparisons against literals and function-returned booleans with selective boxing/unboxing. See also generator snapshot: Js2IL.Tests/BinaryOperator/GeneratorTests.BinaryOperator_EqualBoolean.verified.txt.
Value result emitted via Ceq inversion; conditional form branches with bne.un. Unboxing/coercion rules mirror equality operator handling for numbers/booleans.
Implemented alongside != in the IL generator (value + branching). Dedicated tests to be added; semantics match JavaScript strict inequality (no type coercion).

Value form returns left if truthy, otherwise right; branching form uses JS ToBoolean for conditions. Right-hand side is not evaluated when short-circuited. Recent fixes ensure strict-equality patterns (e.g. `id === 1024 || id === 2047`) correctly handle captured/boxed variables by performing ToNumber conversion when the variable type is unknown, preventing incorrect direct object-to-number `ceq` comparisons.
Value form returns left if falsy, otherwise right; branching form uses JS ToBoolean for conditions. Right-hand side is not evaluated when short-circuited.

Implements key in obj via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.HasPropertyIn. Supports own properties on ExpandoObject/object literals and numeric/string keys; does not yet traverse prototype chain or throw TypeError for non-object RHS beyond null/undefined.
Expression-level branching with both arms coerced to object where needed; only the selected arm is evaluated. Verified via generator and execution tests in ControlFlow subgroup.

Supports assignment to non-computed member targets and returns the assigned value (JavaScript assignment-expression semantics). Emitted via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.SetItem(obj, key, value) with a string key. Supports ExpandoObject (object literals) and reflection-backed host objects; strings are treated as immutable and ignore writes.

features.feature: Computed property/index assignment (obj[index] = value; arr[i] = value)
features.notes: Supports computed MemberExpression assignment via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.SetItem(obj, index, value). Works for object literals (ExpandoObject), JavaScriptRuntime.Array index writes (including extending length), and Int32Array index writes.

Supports destructuring assignment expressions with object/array patterns. Applies defaults when extracted values are undefined and supports rest elements/properties. The overall assignment expression evaluates to the RHS value.
+= on identifiers uses JavaScriptRuntime.Operators.Add for JS coercion and stores back to the same binding; validated by generator snapshot.
Emits load-convert-operate-convert-store pattern with int32 operations. Operands are converted to int32, operation applied, result converted back to double for storage.
Arithmetic operations work on double values. Exponentiation (**=) uses System.Math.Pow. All operators properly preserve JavaScript numeric semantics.
Function returns propagate values (boxed) to callers; validated by execution snapshot showing returned value.
Logical not in conditional test supported.
Compares function-returned boolean to true and branches accordingly.
Conditions like if (url) are coerced via JS ToBoolean semantics (empty string/0/NaN/undefined/null => false; others => true).
continue branches to the post-body test point (LoopContext).
break branches to loop end (LoopContext).
Supports continue <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.
Supports break <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.
continue branches to loop head (LoopContext).
break branches to loop end (LoopContext).
Supports continue <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.
Supports break <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.
Implements continue by branching to the update expression (LoopContext).
Implements break by branching to loop end label (LoopContext).
Supports continue <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.
Supports break <label> where <label> targets an enclosing loop.

Lowered to an index loop over a normalized iterable (JavaScriptRuntime.Object.NormalizeForOfIterable), then accessed via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.GetLength(object) + GetItem(object, double). Supports arrays, strings, typed arrays, and .NET IEnumerable (via Array.from), but does not implement full JS iterator protocol (Symbol.iterator).

Lowered to an index loop over JavaScriptRuntime.Object.GetEnumerableKeys(object). Minimal semantics: supports ExpandoObject (object literals), JS Array/Int32Array/string index keys, and IDictionary keys; does not currently model full prototype-chain enumeration rules.
Supports fallthrough semantics, default placement, multiple case labels sharing a body, nested switch break behavior, and labeled break out of a switch.
Supports throwing any JS value. Non-Exception values are wrapped in JavaScriptRuntime.JsThrownValueException; catch unwrapping binds the original value. JavaScriptRuntime.Error is thrown directly.
Catch blocks handle values thrown within the try region (including non-Exception JS values via JsThrownValueException) and bind the caught value only when a binding is present.
Catch parameter binding is block-scoped to the catch clause and does not leak outside the catch block.
Supports catch + finally with correct finally execution and catch binding when throwing arbitrary JS values.
Finally emission is in place and executes on normal and return exits. Execution test for unhandled throw is skipped pending top-level unhandled Error semantics; generator snapshot verifies structure.
Emitted by assigning defaults in the generated .ctor.
Emitted as a static field initialized in a synthesized .cctor; accessed via ldsfld.

features.feature: Constructor with parameter and this.field assignment; method reads field
Constructor with multiple parameters; method uses fields
features.notes: Covers multi-parameter constructors and arithmetic in instance methods.

features.feature: Private instance field (#) with helper method access
features.notes: Generated as a private .NET field with a mangled name; accessible only within the class.

features.feature: Class methods and constructors accessing ancestor scope variables (global, function, block)
features.notes: Class methods and constructors can now access variables from all ancestor scopes (global, function, block), not just the global scope. Implementation walks the scope tree from the class's parent scope to root, building a complete ancestor chain. The scope array is passed as an argument to methods/constructors, enabling proper multi-level scope access. Supports regular functions, arrow functions, and constructor parameters. Fixed parameter indexing for constructors: when scopes are present, arg0=this, arg1=scopes[], parameters start at arg2.

Class constructors support default parameter values and destructuring with defaults. Call sites validate argument count against min/max parameter bounds and pad missing optional arguments with ldnull. Default values are applied using starg IL pattern when arguments are null. Object destructuring parameters support default values (e.g., constructor({host="localhost", port=8080})) with conditional IL generation.

Class instance methods support default parameter values and destructuring with defaults. Methods are registered in ClassRegistry with min/max parameter counts. Call sites validate argument count ranges and pad missing optional parameters with ldnull before callvirt. Object destructuring parameters support default values with conditional IL generation.

subsections.title: Value Properties of the Math Object

features.notes: Euler’s number e.
Natural logarithm of 10.
Natural logarithm of 2.
Base-10 logarithm of e.
Base-2 logarithm of e.
Ratio of a circle’s circumference to its diameter.
Square root of 1/2.
Square root of 2.

subsections.title: Function Properties of the Math Object

features.notes: Returns the absolute value; NaN propagates; ±Infinity preserved.
Returns arc cosine in radians; out-of-domain yields NaN.
Inverse hyperbolic cosine; x < 1 yields NaN; Infinity preserved.
Returns arc sine in radians; out-of-domain yields NaN.
Inverse hyperbolic sine; handles ±0, NaN, ±Infinity per spec.
Returns arc tangent in radians; NaN propagates; ±Infinity maps to ±π/2.
Quadrant-aware arc tangent; handles zeros, NaN, and infinities per spec.
Implements ceiling for numbers represented as double; arguments coerced via minimal ToNumber semantics. Returns NaN for NaN/undefined or negative zero preserved via .NET semantics.
Counts leading zero bits in the 32-bit unsigned integer representation.
Cosine of x (radians); NaN propagates; Infinity yields NaN.
Hyperbolic cosine; handles ±0, NaN, ±Infinity per spec.
e^x; consistent with JS semantics for NaN and infinities.
Returns e^x - 1 with improved precision for small x.
Largest integer less than or equal to x; preserves -0 when appropriate.
Rounds to nearest 32-bit float; preserves signed zero.
Computes sqrt(sum(x_i^2)); returns Infinity if any arg is ±Infinity; NaN if any arg is NaN and none are Infinity.
C-style 32-bit integer multiplication with wrapping.
Natural logarithm; log(1) = 0; negative x yields NaN; log(0) = -Infinity.
Base-10 logarithm; JS semantics for 0, negatives, NaN, and infinities.
log(1 + x) with improved precision for small x.
Base-2 logarithm; JS semantics for 0, negatives, NaN, and infinities.
Returns the largest of the given numbers; with no arguments returns -Infinity; if any argument is NaN returns NaN.
Returns the square root for non-negative inputs; negative or NaN yields NaN; Infinity maps to Infinity.
Exponentiation; consistent with JS semantics including NaN and Infinity cases.
Returns a pseudo-random number in the range [0, 1).
Rounds to the nearest integer; ties at .5 round up toward +∞; exact -0.5 returns -0.
Returns 1, -1, 0, -0, or NaN depending on the sign of x; ±Infinity map to ±1.
Sine of x (radians); NaN propagates; Infinity yields NaN.
Hyperbolic sine; handles ±0, NaN, ±Infinity per spec.
Tangent of x (radians); NaN propagates; Infinity yields NaN.
Hyperbolic tangent; handles ±0, NaN, ±Infinity per spec.
Removes fractional part; preserves sign for zero (can return -0).
Returns the smallest of the given numbers; with no arguments returns Infinity; if any argument is NaN returns NaN.
Cube root; handles negative values returning negative result; NaN propagates; Infinity preserved.
Implements the ES static method with no coercion: returns true only when x is a Number value and is NaN. Backed by JavaScriptRuntime.Number.isNaN(object?).
Constructs a Date representing now (UTC). Stores milliseconds since Unix epoch internally.
Constructs from milliseconds since Unix epoch; numeric argument is coerced per JS ToNumber minimal behavior.
Returns current time in milliseconds since Unix epoch as a number (boxed double).
Parses an ISO-like string to milliseconds since Unix epoch, or NaN on failure; returns a number (boxed double).

subsections.title: Properties of the Date Prototype Object

features.notes: Returns milliseconds since Unix epoch as a number (boxed double).
Returns a UTC ISO 8601 string with millisecond precision and trailing 'Z'.
length getter returns number of elements; emitted via JavaScriptRuntime.Object.GetLength(object). Used by for-of implementation.
Elements are stringified via DotNet2JSConversions.ToString and joined with a separator (default ','). Codegen dispatches to JavaScriptRuntime.Array.join(object[]).
Removes and returns the last element; when empty returns undefined (represented as null in this runtime).
Appends items to the end of the array and returns the new length (as a JS number).

Supports value-callback mapping including nested callback closures. thisArg and standard callback parameter injections (index, array) are not yet supported; callback currently receives only the element value. Returns a new array.
Default lexicographic sort implemented in JavaScriptRuntime.Array.sort(); comparator function parameter is not yet supported. Returns the array instance.
Returns a shallow copy; handles negative indices and undefined end per spec.
Mutates the array by removing and/or inserting elements; returns an array of removed elements.
Returns true for JavaScriptRuntime.Array instances; false otherwise.

features.feature: Int32Array: new Int32Array(length), length, index get/set (basic)
features.notes: Minimal typed array: exposes numeric length, supports indexing; out-of-bounds reads return 0 and out-of-bounds writes are ignored.

features.feature: Int32Array from array-like (copy and ToInt32 coercion)
features.notes: Copies from array-like and coerces values using ToInt32-style truncation; NaN/Infinity/±0 become 0.
Copies elements from array-like or another Int32Array with optional offset; elements are coerced via ToInt32; offset < 0 treated as 0; copies stop at destination length.
Reflection-based string dispatch routes CLR string receivers to JavaScriptRuntime.String.StartsWith with optional position argument. Returns a boolean value (boxed).

Reflection-based dispatch recognizes definite string receivers and routes to JavaScriptRuntime.String.Includes; supports optional position argument. Returns a boolean value. (No dedicated JS fixture currently referenced in this doc.)

Implemented in JavaScriptRuntime.String and wired via IL generator for definite string receivers. Supports optional end position. Returns a boolean value. (No dedicated JS fixture currently referenced in this doc.)

Supports string and regular-expression separators and optional limit. Implemented via JavaScriptRuntime.String.Split and returned as JavaScriptRuntime.Array. Separator omitted or undefined returns [input]. Empty string separator splits into individual UTF-16 code units.

Supported when the receiver is String(x), the pattern is a regular expression literal, and the replacement is a string. Global (g) and ignoreCase (i) flags are honored. Function replacement, non-regex patterns, and other flags are not yet implemented. Implemented via host intrinsic JavaScriptRuntime.String.Replace and dynamic resolution in IL generator.
Returns a number (boxed double) consistent with ECMAScript compare semantics; numeric option supported.

Implemented via host intrinsic JavaScriptRuntime.JSON.Parse(string). Maps invalid input to SyntaxError and non-string input to TypeError. Reviver parameter is not supported. Objects become ExpandoObject, arrays use JavaScriptRuntime.Array, numbers use double.
Backed by JavaScriptRuntime.Set.add; returns the Set instance to allow chaining. (No dedicated JS fixture currently referenced in this doc.)
Backed by JavaScriptRuntime.Set.has; strict equality for keys based on .NET object identity and string/double value semantics. (No dedicated JS fixture currently referenced in this doc.)
Exposed via a 'size' property on JavaScriptRuntime.Set returning a JS number (double). (No dedicated JS fixture currently referenced in this doc.)

Constructor accepts an executor delegate and supports the basic resolve/reject fast-paths and dynamic delegate invocation used in tests. Promise.resolve/reject create already-settled Promise instances.

Implements `then`, `catch`, and `finally` with microtask scheduling support. `finally` handlers are treated as observers: non-Promise return values do not alter the settled result, while returned Promises are awaited and propagated (fixed earlier bug where Promise returns from finally were masked). Tests include chaining and then/catch/finally interactions.
Returns a Promise that resolves when all input promises resolve (with an array of results), or rejects when any input promise rejects (with the first rejection reason).
Returns a Promise that resolves when all input promises have settled (fulfilled or rejected), with an array of outcome objects containing status and value/reason.
Returns a Promise that resolves as soon as any input promise resolves, or rejects with an AggregateError if all input promises reject.
Returns a Promise that settles as soon as any input promise settles (resolves or rejects), with the same value or reason.
